title: Nicola Sturgeon claims separate Scotland will be 'bridge' between UK and EU despite hard border prospect
text:
Nicola Sturgeon is to claim a separate Scotland will be a "bridge" between the UK and EU despite SNP plans for a new currency and the threat of a hard border.

In a marked about-turn on her previous political narrative, the First Minister will use her keynote speech to the SNP conference in Aberdeen to argue that Brexit will benefit an independent Scotland.

She will argue that a separate Scotland would have a "unique advantage" by being in the EU single market while being the "closest" geographical neighbour to the rest of the UK.

Ms Sturgeon claimed this would make a separate Scotland a "magnet for global investment" and insisted it could have "the best of both worlds."
